title: Mural of Lioness Leah Williamson unveiled in Holloway Road
body_text:
Pepsi MAX has unveiled a mural of England captain Leah Williamson as part of a campaign promoting women’s football.
The artwork is one of two in Pepsi MAX's new campaign, also featuring Lionesses' forward Lauren James.
The murals were unveiled in Holloway Road, Islington, and in Chelsea in April to celebrate the two players joining the brand's ambassador roster.
The two footballers will also feature on limited edition Pepsi MAX cans and bottles in the run up to the Euros this summer.
Arsenal star Williamson, who led the Lionesses to their UEFA European Championship win in 2022, added: "I’m so proud to be a part of the Pepsi MAX line-up because for me, it’s always been about more than just football.
"It's about using the platform we have to create real change, to inspire the next generation and to show that anything is possible
"The growth of women's football isn't just about what happens on the pitch; it's about creating a lasting legacy and ensuring the progress we've made continues.”
England forward Lauren James said: "I'm incredibly passionate about the continued growth of women's football, and it's a real honour to be partnering with Pepsi MAX who clearly share that vision.
"We've seen so much positive momentum recently, and it's important we keep pushing forward, increasing visibility, and making sure the women's game reaches its full potential.
"This partnership is a great opportunity to contribute to that and inspire the next generation of players and fans."
